segment.source: Beta testing
segment.target: Beta testing

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Beta testing gives you the chance to improve your app based on feedback from individuals outside of your app-development team who try your unreleased app on their own devices.
segment.target: Beta testing gives you the chance to improve your app based on feedback from individuals outside of your app-development team who try your unreleased app on their own devices.

segment.source: This section describes your options for beta testing Universal Windows apps.
segment.target: This section describes your options for beta testing Universal Windows apps.

segment.source: Why beta test?
segment.target: Why beta test?

segment.source: To thoroughly test an app, you need to try it against as many device configurations and user interactions as possible.
segment.target: To thoroughly test an app, you need to try it against as many device configurations and user interactions as possible.

segment.source: Doing all of that testing in-house is difficult if not impossible.
segment.target: Doing all of that testing in-house is difficult if not impossible.

segment.source: With beta testing, users try your app on their own devices.
segment.target: With beta testing, users try your app on their own devices.

segment.source: And it's unmoderated: instead of performing specified tasks, users have complete freedom in how they use an app, so they can find issues that you might never have expected.
segment.target: And it's unmoderated: instead of performing specified tasks, users have complete freedom in how they use an app, so they can find issues that you might never have expected.

segment.source: With beta testing, you can:
segment.target: With beta testing, you can:

segment.source: Test your app on a variety of devices.
segment.target: Test your app on a variety of devices.

segment.source: Identify performance issues and other bugs that you might not have found otherwise.
segment.target: Identify performance issues and other bugs that you might not have found otherwise.

segment.source: Get real-world usage info that can be used improve the user experience.
segment.target: Get real-world usage info that can be used improve the user experience.

segment.source: Receive feedback without affecting public ratings in the Windows Store.
segment.target: Receive feedback without affecting public ratings in the Windows Store.

segment.source: When to beta test
segment.target: When to beta test

segment.source: It's best to conduct beta testing as the final stage of testing before you release your app.
segment.target: It's best to conduct beta testing as the final stage of testing before you release your app.

segment.source: At that point, you have tested the app as thoroughly as you can yourself, and you've covered all explicit use cases.
segment.target: At that point, you have tested the app as thoroughly as you can yourself, and you've covered all explicit use cases.

segment.source: Beta testing is not a substitute for other testing methods.
segment.target: Beta testing is not a substitute for other testing methods.

segment.source: Since beta testing is unmoderated, participants may not catch all bugs in your code because every tester's experience is self-directed and it's unlikely that they'll explore all features of the app.
segment.target: Since beta testing is unmoderated, participants may not catch all bugs in your code because every tester's experience is self-directed and it's unlikely that they'll explore all features of the app.

segment.source: But beta-testing feedback can give you a final wave of real-world feedback that reveals issues that you might never have expected before you go live.
segment.target: But beta-testing feedback can give you a final wave of real-world feedback that reveals issues that you might never have expected before you go live.

segment.source: Next steps
segment.target: Next steps

segment.source: In the unified Windows Dev Center dashboard, you can limit distribution of your apps to only your testers, regardless of which operating systems your app targets.
segment.target: In the unified Windows Dev Center dashboard, you can limit distribution of your apps to only your testers, regardless of which operating systems your app targets.

segment.source: There’s no need to create a separate version of your app with a separate name and package identity; you can do your testing, then create a new submission when you’re ready to make the app available to everyone.
segment.target: There’s no need to create a separate version of your app with a separate name and package identity; you can do your testing, then create a new submission when you’re ready to make the app available to everyone.

segment.source: (Of course, you can create a separate app for testing only if you prefer.
segment.target: (Of course, you can create a separate app for testing only if you prefer.

segment.source: If you do, make sure to give it a different name from what you intend as the final, public app name.)
segment.target: If you do, make sure to give it a different name from what you intend as the final, public app name.)

segment.source: See Beta testing and targeted distribution to learn how to submit your app to the Store for beta testing.
segment.target: See Beta testing and targeted distribution to learn how to submit your app to the Store for beta testing.
